doc.after: Bermudian English is a regional accent of English found in Bermuda a British overseas territory in the North Atlantic Standard English is used in professional settings and in writing while vernacular Bermudian English is spoken on more casual occasions 1 The Bermudian accent began to develop following settlement in the early 17th century and retains traits of Elizabethan English 2
